urls.title: Fly tipping
urls.description: You face an unlimited fine if your waste is fly-tipped. Use a licensed carrier or take your waste to a registered site. Report a fly tip. Check a licence.

urls.title: The Flood Hub
urls.description: Posted: 07/06/21 From 14th ‚Äì 18th May we are hosting a Sustainable Drainage Systems (SuDS) Focus Week, looking at what SuDS are, how they reduce flood risk, and the many benefits they provide. There will be examples of the types of SuDS you can install in your home and garden, and case studies of larger SuDS projects across the North West. Posted: 24/05/21 On 19 May 2021 four new flood warning services were launched in Coniston (Cumbria) Caton (Lancashire), and Worthington and Atherton (Greater Manchester)

text: @cleanupbritain @DefraGovUK @WasteCrimeWatch So waste crime costs the country ¬£600 million and @EnvAgency and @DefraGovUK manage to get in about ¬£4 million in fines well thats all good then! What a joke. If theres roughly 500,000 offences at ¬£50,000 per fine i make that ¬£25,000,000,000 ups the budget a bit
@cleanupbritain ‚ÄòAppallingly inept and relentlessly incompetent‚Äô pretty accurate and eloquently put i would say. No point in laws without enforcement, step up to plate @DefraGovUK and @EnvAgency

@moorsforfuture @stwater @YorkshireWater @unitedutilities @peakdistrict @MarsdenmoorNT @nationaltrust @pennineprospect @RSPBDoveStone @LIFEprogramme @EnvAgency Is any of it it regularly tested for the presence of Flubendazole? This is, as you know, spread widely across the peatlands, with absolutely no control over dosage. Wasn't there a PhD project set up a year or two ago on this matter? Any results yet?

@WasteCrimeWatch @EnvAgency @letsrecycle i missed this so i dont know the content and im sure its well meaning we all need more of this discussion but i do agree that the @EnvAgency and @DefraGovUK need to be involved.
@WildStoke @jogideon @EnvAgencyMids A good lunch probably improves health and well-being more. What do you think @jogideon ?

text: @360wastesupport @MRWmagazine Totally agree. Start with the waste producers and prosecute your way down the chain. Many large companies wont take the risk of EA action but they know the @EnvAgency is weak and ineffective so they use criminals to move their waste with total immunity

@WasteCrimeWatch @EnvAgency Underfunding is criminal yes, but also the system is broken. It favours criminality, period. Laws are pointless without enforcement, subsistence fees should be spent on enforcement first and fines should be retained by the @EnvAgency and spent on more enforcement
